description: Independent assessment involving water use data collection over three weeks and writing a scientific report (Introduction, Methods, Results, Discussion, Conclusions) about residential water patterns.
Four practical exercises involving geospatial data analysis, field data collection, and sediment/soil analysis. Each exercise worth 10% with tasks submitted weekly or during labs.
1-1.5 hour assessment on first half of course content through multiple choice, short and long answer questions based on lectures.
1-1.5 hour assessment on second half of course content through multiple choice, short and long answer questions based on lectures (not held during formal exam period).
